TEXT: Initial SmartCollar design specs finalized. Moisture resistance rated for IP67.
First production run successful. All units passing 85% RH threshold test.
Customer satisfaction at 98% for SmartCollar. Great job team!
New moisture sensor calibration process implemented. Improved accuracy by 15%.
Quality audit complete. All batches meeting IP67 standards.
SmartCollar return rate holding steady at 2.1%. Industry leading!
Updated moisture sensor firmware v2.0 deployed. Enhanced power efficiency.
Production capacity increased. Quality metrics maintained.
EMEA satisfaction scores highest among all regions.
SmartCollar v2 design phase starting. Focus on battery optimization.
New supplier for moisture sensors approved. Same specs, better cost.
SmartCollar consistently outperforming competitors in wet weather tests.
Starting production validation for new sensor batch.
New supplier's first major batch (lot 340) passes all QC tests.
Starting QA on SmartCollar lot 341. Initial tests look normal.
@john.qc noticed some inconsistent readings on the moisture sensors for lot 341. Running additional tests.
Moisture sensor calibration on lot 341 showing higher sensitivity than spec. @sarah.eng can we check the baseline?
Confirmed issue with moisture sensitivity. Lot 341 triggering at 65% RH instead of 85% RH spec.
Seeing first customer reports about battery drain on new SmartCollar units. Any known issues?
Investigating battery drain reports. Might be related to moisture sensor cycling.
Root cause identified: moisture sensor triggering too frequently, causing excessive battery drain.
All lot 341 units affected by moisture sensor calibration issue. Estimated 2500 units shipped to EMEA.
Developing firmware hotfix for moisture sensor threshold. Should reduce battery drain.
Multiple returns from EMEA region, all citing battery life issues. Most from lot 341.
Firmware hotfix ready for deployment. Increases moisture threshold to 85% RH.
Firmware update helping some cases, but seeing physical damage from moisture in returns.
Analysis shows lot 341 moisture sensor issue is hardware-related. Can't fully fix with firmware.
Return rate for lot 341 now at 35%. Mostly from high-humidity regions in EMEA.
New manufacturing process implemented for moisture sensor calibration. Future lots will meet 85% RH spec.
Investigating alternative moisture sensor suppliers for future production.
Quality audit of remaining lot 341 stock confirms systemic calibration issue.
Implementing proactive replacement program for affected EMEA customers.
New sensor validation protocol developed to prevent future calibration issues.
First batch with new validation protocol shows consistent 85% RH threshold.
Customer satisfaction improving with replacement program.
Long-term fix: Adding automated calibration verification to production line.
New automated calibration system being installed. Testing begins next week.
